items.title: Game Deals: NBA 2K26 $50 Amazon low on all platforms, Daemon X Machina, more
items.summary:
Amazon is now offering its best price yet on NBA 2K26. You’ll find both the PS5 and Xbox Series X|S versions sitting down at $49.99 shipped, delivering nearly 30% in savings on the regular $70 list price. The same goes for the Switch 2 Game-Key Card edition that is also now at the $49.99 Amazon all-time low. We started to see some price drop on the latest edition of 2K NBA simulation at the top of September but this is the first time we have seen the game approaching the 30% off marker there. 

Today’s NBA 2K26 also joins a host of Square Enix titles on sale at Best Buy right here alongside some new and ongoing offers you will find down below.

more…

items.title: Adobe launches AI Foundry, a new program to help enterprise customers create bespoke, commercially safe, Firefly-based generative AI models trained on their IP (Webb Wright/ZDNET)
items.summary:
Webb Wright / ZDNET:
Adobe launches AI Foundry, a new program to help enterprise customers create bespoke, commercially safe, Firefly-based generative AI models trained on their IP  —  ZDNET's key takeaways  — Adobe assures its new AI model service is copyright-safe.  — Foundry models leverage Firefly and are trained on brands' IP.

items.title: The UK CMA says Getty Images and Shutterstock's $3.7B merger causes competition concerns and gives the companies until October 27 to offer plan to address them (Ian Walker/Wall Street Journal)
items.summary:
Ian Walker / Wall Street Journal:
The UK CMA says Getty Images and Shutterstock's $3.7B merger causes competition concerns and gives the companies until October 27 to offer plan to address them  —  The regulator says it will refer the deal for further investigation if the companies don't provide an acceptable undertaking to address concerns

items.title: Oura redesigns app with expanded stress tracking
items.summary: Oura is launching a redesigned app with expanded stress-tracking insights as it develops new blood pressure features that could identify signs of hypertension. The updated Oura app will introduce a new Cumulative Stress feature that provides a weekly overview of how the body manages and recovers from sustained stress, drawing from sleep, heart rate, temperature, […]

We featured a deal late last week on the 512GB M3 iPad Air with the cell connectivity at a new all-time low. But after a pair of additional price drops, we are now looking at nearly $280 off the list price and a new Amazon all-time low once again.

OpenEvidence, which makes an ad-supported AI chatbot for medical practitioners, raised $200M at a $6B valuation, up from $3.5B after raising $210M in July  —  The three-year-old artificial intelligence start-up has drawn investor attention, and money, as its use among doctors, nurses and others skyrockets.

items.summary:
There’s been a couple trends in power bank design over the last couple years – see through form-factors that show off the internals and onboard displays. The new Lenovo 140W Smart Laptop Power Bank has both of them and it’s making its way stateside as a listing has just appeared on Amazon.

Among this week’s best e-bike deals, Lectric’s Spooky Sale has increased savings up to $762 on its e-bike bundles starting from $999, with some other notable chances to score the Tenways AGO X All-Terrain Mid-Drive e-bike with a $500 price cut and $616 in FREE gear (including an extra battery) for $1,999, as well as Vanpowers’ City Vanture back at $799, and more.

We’ve had quite the exciting week of new power station launches/early-bird savings, like Bluetti’s Na(Sodium) Portable Power Station with up to $920 in exclusive savings, the 50% off discounts on Anker’s new SOLIX C2000 Gen 2 Portable Power Station, or the $1,000 off super early-bird opportunity for EcoFlow’s upcoming DELTA Pro Ultra X Whole-Home Power Station, and much more.

items.title: Senate Republicans deepfaked Chuck Schumer, and X hasn’t taken it down
items.summary: The video was posted Friday on the Senate Republicans' X account. According to X’s policies, the platform prohibits “deceptively shar[ing] synthetic or manipulated media that are likely to cause harm.” Harmful content includes media that could “mislead people” or “cause significant confusion on public issues.”
